from collections import Counter
import re

def is_isogram(word):
    # Check if input is a string
    if not isinstance(word, str):
        return False
    
    # Check if input is empty
    if len(word) == 0:
        return False
    
    # Remove non-letter characters
    word = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', word)
    
    # Convert all letters to lowercase
    word = word.lower()
    
    # Count the occurrences of each letter
    letter_counts = Counter(word)
    
    # Check if all letters have the same count
    if len(set(letter_counts.values())) == 1:
        return True
    
    return False

def is_isogram(word):
    if not isinstance(word, str): # checks if word is not a string
        return False
    if not word: # checks if word is empty or None
        return False
    word = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', word.lower()) # removes non-letter characters and converts word to lowercase
    counter = Counter(word) # counts the occurrence of each letter in the word
    letter_count = counter.most_common(1)[0][1] # gets the count of the most common letter
    return all(count == letter_count for count in counter.values()) # checks if all counts are equal to the count of the most common letter

def is_isogram(word):
    if not isinstance(word, str): # checks if word is not a string
        return False
    if not word: # checks if word is empty or None

    word = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', word.lower()) # removes non-letter characters and converts word to lowercase
